casebody.data:
FREDERICK H. CONE & CO., Inc., et al., Libellants-Appellants, v. THE TAI SHAN, her engines, etc., THE WILHELM WILHELMSEN, N. A. A. L., Wilhelmsen's D/S A/S, THE TONSBERG, THE TANKFART I, THE TANKFART IV, THE TANKFART V. and THE TANKFART VI, Claimants-Respondents-Appellees. No. 148, Docket 23228. United States Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Argued Jan. 12, 13, 1955. Decided Jan. 25, 1955. Henry N. Longley, New York City (Bigham, Englar, Jones & Houston and F. Herbert Prem, New York City, on the brief), for libellants-appellants. Charles S. Haight, New York City (Haight, Deming, Gardner, Poor & Havens and Richard G. Ashworth, New York City, on the brief), for claimants-respondents-appellees.

Before CLARK, Chief Judge, and FRANK and HINCKS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Affirmed on the opinion of District Judge Dimock, Haroco Co., Inc., v. The Tai Shan, D.C., 111 F.Supp. 638, 1953 A.M.C. 887.
